ygData.subject: Re: [rest-discuss] REST-*
ygData.msgSnippet: What has Atom got to do with message queues or pub/sub? It is a format. It does not specify any protocol.

What has Atom got to do with message queues or pub/sub? It is a  
format. It does not specify any protocol.

On Sep 16, 2009, at 4:57 PM, Bill Burke wrote:

>
>
> Ryan Riley wrote:
>> As to the idea of a message queue being only a non-REST  
>> architectural pattern, I don't quite follow. (Of course, I'm still  
>> new to most of this so I would generally just nod and accept.) What  
>> is Atom if not an excellent medium for providing a message queue?  
>> Why not POST/PUT the intermediary resources, display their state  
>> via Atom feeds and, once everything is published, take your final  
>> action to the final state? You now have a transaction-ish process  
>> using fully RESTful /and/ meaningful semantics with full audit  
>> support.
>
> I think Roy means queue vs. pub/sub?  Atom is pub/sub.
>
>
> -- 
> Bill Burke
> JBoss, a division of Red Hat
> http://bill.burkecentral.com
